Ever since the Zhou, Qin and Han dynasties, the Three Prefectures had been as rich as brocade, and the eight rivers had flowed round its wal s.

On his long journey he wil visit many a country; Thousands of cloud-capped mountains lie before him.

item.title: CHAPTER 14
item.description: CHAPTER 14 The Mind-Ape Returns to Truth The Six Bandits Disappear Without Trace Buddha is the mind, the mind is Buddha, Mind and Buddha have always needed things. When you know that there are no things and no mind Then you are a Buddha with a true mind and a Dharma body. A Dharma-bodied Buddha has no form; A single divine light contains the ten thousand images. The bodiless body is the true body.

item.title: CHAPTER 15

They had been travel ing for several days in the twelfth month of the year, with its freezing North winds and biting cold. Their path wound along overhanging precipices and steep cliffs, and they crossed range after range of dangerous mountains.

item.title: CHAPTER 16

True gentlemen who never strive are famed for ever; The virtue-loving sages are renowned to this day.

As he looked at the sea, Vast were the misty waters, Boundless the mighty waves. The vast and misty waters stretched to the Milky Way; The boundless and mighty waves were linked to the earth’s arteries.

item.title: CHAPTER 29

Once awakened you can achieve the Right in an instant; The confused wil drift for ten thousand aeons. If you can invoke the Buddha and cultivate the Truth, Sins countless as the Ganges sands can be wiped out.
